metadata.name: Database Connectivity Architecture
metadata.description: Core specification for database connectivity across all environments and drivers

core_principle.title: Universal Database Connectivity
core_principle.description: The platform MUST maintain consistent database connectivity across all environments (development, staging, production) and handle driver incompatibilities transparently. SSL parameter conflicts between asyncpg and psycopg2 drivers MUST be resolved automatically to prevent connection failures.

component.name: CoreDatabaseManager
component.purpose: Centralized database URL management and driver compatibility

responsibilities.responsibility: Automatic driver selection based on context

strategy.description: Local PostgreSQL with flexible SSL configuration
Cloud SQL with SSL or Unix socket
strategy.ssl_requirement: Required for TCP, None for Unix socket

ssl_parameter_resolution.problem: asyncpg driver uses 'ssl=' parameter while psycopg2 uses 'sslmode=' parameter. This incompatibility causes connection failures when URLs are shared between sync and async operations.

solution.description: Automatically converts SSL parameters based on the target driver and connection type. Removes ALL SSL parameters for Unix socket connections where SSL is handled at the socket level.

rules.rule: For asyncpg: Convert sslmode=require to ssl=require
For psycopg2: Convert ssl=require to sslmode=require
For Unix sockets (/cloudsql/): Remove ALL SSL parameters

async_session_management.problem: SQLAlchemy async sessions can raise IllegalStateChangeError when trying to close a session that is in the middle of another operation like '_connection_for_bind()'. This occurs due to race conditions in concurrent database operations, particularly when tasks are cancelled or generators are cleaned up.

solution.description: Check session state before performing any operations to prevent IllegalStateChangeError. Handle task cancellation and generator cleanup gracefully without forcing session operations.

implementation.code: # CRITICAL FIX: State-aware session management async with async_session_factory() as session: session_yielded = False try: session_yielded = True yield session # Only commit if session is active and has a transaction if hasattr(session, 'is_active') and session.is_active: if hasattr(session, 'in_transaction') and session.in_transaction(): await session.commit() except asyncio.CancelledError: # Handle task cancellation - let context manager handle cleanup raise except GeneratorExit: # Handle generator cleanup - session context manager handles this pass except Exception: # Only rollback if session is in valid state with active transaction if (session_yielded and hasattr(session, 'is_active') and session.is_active and hasattr(session, 'in_transaction') and session.in_transaction()): try: await session.rollback() except Exception: # If rollback fails, let context manager handle cleanup pass raise

best_practices.practice: Always check session state with hasattr() before accessing properties
Verify is_active before attempting commits or rollbacks
Check in_transaction() before attempting transaction operations
Let SQLAlchemy's context manager handle cleanup on failures
Use session_yielded flag to track session lifecycle in generators
Wrap rollback operations in try-except to handle cleanup failures gracefully

affected_files.file: All files using async session management

url_normalization.principle: Simplified URLs with automatic driver addition

approach.step: Store simplified postgresql:// URLs in configuration
Add driver prefixes automatically at runtime
Apply SSL parameter resolution after driver selection

health_checks.requirement: Health check endpoints MUST handle database connectivity gracefully, including lazy initialization and SSL parameter resolution.

migration_support.requirement: Alembic migrations MUST use synchronous drivers (psycopg2) to prevent greenlet/asyncio compatibility issues.

requirement.name: Pre-deployment Validation
requirement.description: Database credentials and connectivity MUST be validated before deployment completion to prevent startup failures.

validation_steps.step: Test connection with resolved SSL parameters

requirement.name: Environment Detection
requirement.description: Services MUST detect environment correctly to apply appropriate connection strategies and SSL requirements.

pattern.name: Connection Failure
pattern.error: connect() got an unexpected keyword argument 'sslmode'
pattern.cause: Using psycopg2 SSL parameters with asyncpg driver

pattern.name: Authentication Failure
pattern.cause: Incorrect or outdated credentials in DATABASE_URL
pattern.solution: Update credentials in Secret Manager and validate

pattern.name: SSL Requirement
pattern.error: SSL connection required but not provided
pattern.cause: Missing SSL parameters for staging/production TCP connections

pattern.name: IllegalStateChangeError
pattern.error: Method 'close()' can't be called here; method '_connection_for_bind()' is already running
pattern.cause: Concurrent session operations without proper state checking
pattern.prevention: - Use session_yielded flag to track lifecycle - Handle asyncio.CancelledError separately - Handle GeneratorExit gracefully - Wrap rollback operations in try-except

compliance_checklist.check: All services use CoreDatabaseManager for URL resolution
SSL parameters resolved before connection attempts
Unix socket connections have no SSL parameters
Session state checked with hasattr() before operations to prevent IllegalStateChangeError
AsyncSession lifecycle properly managed with session_yielded flag
Exception handling includes asyncio.CancelledError and GeneratorExit
